content: The AVA Summit is aninternational conference seriesforadvocatesfocusing onsystemic changeand working on various strategies toward one shared vision: Removing animals from our food system and other human use. Upcoming Events

Learn from leading experts and rising stars in the animal and vegan advocacy movement from around the world,​ ​ carefully selected by the AVA Summit Advisory Committee, with topics spanning from public policy, law, food technology, philosophy, scientific research, behavioral studies, media, and so many more.

Committed toinspiringour participants to be asimpactfulas possible,​ ​ we provide an unparalleled platform for learning and networking opportunities that strengthen and nurture our community. We are dedicated to providing this space for global advocates,​ ​ to come together and learn in a highly modern, diverse, progressive, and impactful environment.
" AVA is the highlight of the yearfor networking, fundraising, strategy meetings, and staff connection. Monica Chen, New Roots Institute
" If you were to only choose one conference to go to,we would recommend this one. Constance Li & Sofia Balderson, Hive
" AVA is an anchor for our movement. Meghan O’Brien Lowery, The Greenbaum Foundation
" This is a lineup of truly fantastic speakers.I've never seen such a truly international set of speakersat an animal conference. Peter Singer, Animal Liberation
" AVA is the conference our movement needs.It brings activists from around the worldto be better together. Sharon Núñez Gough, Animal Equality
" Connecting with a diverse group of people in the animal and vegan advocacy movementhas granted me the opportunity to hear fresh, new ideas. ​Naijha Wright-Brown, Black Veg Society
" The AVA Summit reminded us of ourshared vision and collective power. Almira Tanner, Direct Action Everywhere
" The AVA Summit is a highly valuable platform to educate, empower, and connectthose who are working to make the world a better place for animals. Dr. Melanie Joy, Beyond Carnism
" I'm grateful for theopportunity to learn from and be surrounded by so many inspiring peoplemaking a difference for animals. Brooke Haggerty, Faunalytics
" We needed a place toconnect in person, share ideas, bond, and build the future of a movementthat relies so heavily on collaboration. Marie Camino, Mercy For Animals
" There really is nothing that beats being in a room together and sharing our strategiesto make the world a safer place for all sentient beings. Ana Bradley, Sentient Media Thank you to our Sponsors
Stay in the know! Our newsletters will arrive to your inbox every first Tuesday of each month!

The AVA Summit events are organized by AVA International, a nonprofit organization dedicated to creating a world in which animals are taken out of the food system and other human uses. Fiscal sponsorship for AVA International is provided by theHumane America Animal Foundation. Vision and Mission of AVA International Audience Logistical & Organizational Decisions Decisions on Speakers and Programming Locations Finances & Funding Who are AVA Summit Events "For"? Why isn't AVA a hybrid event? How does AVA select Travel Awardees? What are my odds of receiving a Travel Award? How does AVA select Speakers? Why does AVA take place in a hotel, and not a different venue? Why is AVA so expensive? Why isn't there WiFi at the AVA Summit events? Why doesn't AVA cover speaker accommodations? How does AVA save us time & money? Do Steering Committee members and Speakers get special treatment when it comes to speaking opportunities?

Speaker Hotel Accommodations, Policy and Procedures Congratulations on speaking during the Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit! Please review the information below to understand how we have planned to accommodate your stay. Hotel Accommodations and Speakers Requirements We highly recommend staying at the venue hotel to benefit from short distances and networking opportunities. Due to needing to fulfill our contractual obligations for our hotel block, only accommodations at the venue are reimbursable via the travel award system. After you’ve booked, send your confirmation number along toTaylor@AVASummit.com. Please ensure you book inside our block and NOT on 3rd party sites (ex. Expedia, Priceline, Hotels.com) as it ensures you get the lowest rate possible. Speaker Accommodation Limitations This year we are unable to provide hotel accommodations for all speakers. No speakers will have automatic hotel nights covered by AVA, but do please reach out to us if you are in need of financial assistance. Please understand that if you bring family members, we have not factored them into our food & beverage budget. We need to ask that you help us plan ahead by ensuring you, your friends, and your family are all officially registered for the Summit. We want to make sure everyone on-site is well-fed and happy!
Get in touch Anonymous Feedback Form If you’d prefer to remain anonymous, please submit your feedbackhere.

WhoCo-produced by AVA International and in cooperation withSociedade Vegetariana Brasileira(SVB)VegFest Brazil.WhatWe are organizing a new, exciting event where VegFest Brazil meets the AVA Summit Latin America. This unique collaboration will accelerate the animal protection and vegan advocacy movement throughout Latin America and beyond.WherePavilhão Amarelo Galatea - Expo Center Norte, São Paulo, Brazil.>The closest hotel to the venue is theNovotelSão Paulo Center Norte. You will want to stay close to the venue to avoid traffic! **Please book your room here ASAP; rooms will sell out fast!WhenDecember 5-8, 2024*There are more logistical resources at the end of this page. What Does My Ticket Include? •4-day attendance to AVA Summit Latin America / VegFest Brazil​•An exclusive congress kit prepared in collaboration with exhibiting brands and the Brazilian Vegetarian Society •60+ hours of regionally relevant programming•100+ speakers covering essential, interesting, and current topics on animal advocacy and veganism•Access to all attractions and 100+ exhibiting brands at the vegan fair•The rare opportunity to attend the historic collaboration between the Brazilian Vegetarian Society (SVB) and the Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit to elevate veganism throughout Latin America. Speaking Opportunities Deadline to apply isSeptember 15, 2024FormatsMost presentations will be grouped with others on similar topics, with a typical speaking time of 20 minutes plus a shared Q&A. We highly welcome workshops and other creative formats!FocusPlease center your talk/workshop/activity on specific strategies, interventions, learnings, and useful takeaways for the audience, rather than promoting your organization.SubmissionsWe accept one submission per speaker and up to three speakers per organization.DeadlinesSubmit early! Decisions are made on a rolling basis by our Advisory Committee. The submission deadline is August 31, with final decisions by the end of September.

Deadline to apply isSeptember 30, 2024Thanks to our generous donors, we’re able to offer financial support for those who seek to attend the AVA Summit Latin America. Please submit your application by the deadline to be considered.•Travel Awards are available at two levels: $750 USD and $1,000 USD. Please select the award nearest to your need during the application process.•We will review applications on a rolling basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Logistical Resources What is the closest hotel to the event site?The closest hotel is Novotel São Paulo Center Norte.>Please book your room at this hotel ASAP! Rooms will sell out fast.>Visit the websitehere.Is there any shuttle service available?Yes, we will provide a shuttle service from Novotel to Vegfest. Additionally, there will be a shuttle from the nearest metro station to the event.What are the transportation options from the airport to the event site?The international airport (GRU) is about 30-40 minutes away from the event. The best options for transportation are taxi or Uber.Is there a travel agency that offers packages for the event?Yes, Tune Viagens is offering packages in partnership with the event. You can contact them atatendimento@tuneviagens.com.brorvisit their websitefor more information.What are the food options at Vegfest?Vegfest will feature over 100 exhibitors, many of which offer food for you to buy.Are there vegan food options nearby?The neighborhood around the event site does not have many dining options. However, São Paulo has a high number of vegan options in neighborhoods like Pinheiros, Vila Madalena, Jardins, and Consolação, which are about 30-40 minutes by car from the event site.Is there parking available at the event site?Yes, there is paid parking available at the event site.

Code of Conduct & Anti-Harrassment Policy & Procedures Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) International is a global nonprofit hosting a highly modern, diverse, progressive, and impactful conference series for the animal and vegan advocacy movement worldwide. We connect people working on a wide range of tactics, strategies, and approaches, committed to inspiring our participants to be as impactful as possible. We want to nurture the animal and vegan advocacy community worldwide. Expectations At any event organized by Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) International, we do not engage in or tolerate harassment of any kind, including but not limited to: Harassment based on race, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, appearance, religion, immigration status, pregnancy, marital or familial status, military or veteran status, or apparel. Harassment includes but is not limited to: Hostile or denigrating written, verbal, or physical conduct; stalking; verbal or physical intimidation; physical assault and/or battery; harassing or non-consensual photography or recording; disruption of talks or other events; shaming or ridicule; bathroom policing; inappropriate physical contact; and unwelcome physical attention. No policy can fully describe all forms of harassment. AVA International strongly encourages people who believe they or others are being subjected to such conduct to promptly advise the offender that their behavior is unwelcome and request that it be discontinued. If a participant is reported or found to have engaged in harassing, threatening, inappropriate, or unsafe behavior, AVA International retains the right to take any actions reasonable or necessary to keep the event a safe and welcoming environment for all participants. This includes but is not limited to, the expulsion of participant(s) without a refund.

AVA International recognizes that some topics and issues covered at this event may, by their nature, include exposure to controversial, provocative, and challenging ideas. Harassment generally does not include respectful disagreement or good-faith criticism. However, to the extent that discourse distracts from the content or rises to the level of harassment described in the paragraphs above, it will not be tolerated.

This policy extends to all event participants, including sponsors, vendors, independent contractors, attendees, presenters, speakers, volunteers, and workshop participants. AVA International’s events often include volunteers, staff, funders, and organization leaders. Leaders and funders should be particularly aware of the power dynamics that may exist between themselves and other participants and should take special care to be mindful of this so everyone is treated respectfully. Leaders and funders are encouraged to maintain their interactions in the spirit of mentorship if a volunteer or staff member approaches or agrees to socialize with them. AVA International reserves the right to revoke, without refund, registration of any attendee or participant not in compliance with this policy; the right to remove from an event, seminar, or workshop anyone not in compliance with this policy; the right to revoke a speaker invitation; the right to cancel a contract with a sponsor, vendor or contractor that is not in compliance with this policy; as well as the right to ban participation in any future AVA International event. Any sponsor, vendor, independent contractor, speaker, attendee, or anyone affiliated with an event hosted by AVA International who believes they have witnessed or been subjected to harassment or discrimination should report it immediately to AVA’s Executive Director in person or by email atJulia@AVASummit.comor by submittingthis anonymous form. Reporting harassment or discrimination anonymously can empower individuals to share their experiences without fear of retaliation, fostering a safer environment and encouraging more disclosures. However, anonymity may make it challenging for the AVA team to thoroughly investigate and address the issue, potentially hindering the resolution process.

If there is an allegation against the Executive Director, please contact Flavia, Board Treasurer, atFlavia@avasummit.comor Michael Weberman, Board Secretary, atMichael@avasummit.com. If there is an allegation against a member of the Board of Directors, please contact another member of the Board. In both cases, the contacted people will engage with an external and impartial party to conduct the investigative process, and the person against whom the allegation is made will be recused from the process. External investigations will also be conducted in the cases where the person who conducts or oversees investigations would have a conflict of interest or the appearance of a conflict of interest (e.g they’re close friends with the accuser or the person accused).

Legal Please view the AVA Summit Harassment Investigation Policy & Procedure. This policy should not be construed as creating any duty, obligation, or liability on the part of AVA International. Instead, it is solely intended to inform all participants and attendees of our expectations that their behavior complies with this policy. Photos & Videos By registering to attend an event organized by AVA International, you agree that AVA International has the right to use any photographs and videos taken at the event. They may use these in publications or other produced media materials, including but not limited to social media, brochures, websites, promotion of future events, etc. If you do not consent to have your image recorded for distribution, please inform event organizers at least 72 hours before the event atinfo@AVASummit.com.Any person or organization using AVA International’s photographs, graphics, videography, or other similar reproductions or recordings for commercial use requires advance written permission from AVA International.

We work closely with our partners and host venues to implement safety measures so that everyone can enjoy the valuable networking that is a vital part of a live event experience. The Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit is an in-person event. Per the CDC and WHO, we will comply with all local, regional, and national requirements for in-person events. Attendees are encouraged to get vaccinated (and boosted) and test themselves before traveling in highly populated areas. Please; Stay home if you feel unwell: Do not attend if you are displaying symptoms, test positive, or are required to self-isolate. Be mindful of others: Everyone has their own personal comfort level regarding proximity and contact, so please give each other space. Practice hand hygiene: Sanitizers and washrooms will be available throughout the venue. ​ Reduce touch points: Fewer business cards and promotional materials are being shared at live events. Please consider using QR codes or alternative materials. ​ Please check your local WHO and CDC recommendations and guidelines, as well as the travel requirements of your home location. The Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit is not responsible for any expenses or delays incurred due to Covid-19. ​ This page will be updated with any new guidance to comply with the Department of Health recommendations, so please continue to check back as we approach AVA events. ​ Last updated January 4, 2023 Covid Policy

WhoCo-produced by AVA International andAsia For Animals(AfA)Farm Animal Coalition(FAC)WhatAsia Farm Animal Day (AFAD)is a conference dedicated to the people and organizations across Asia working to protect the region's farmed animals. Together, we connect with like-minded advocates, learn from leading pioneers, increase the impact of our work, and create systemic change for farm animals throughout Asia.WhereDaewoo Hanoi Hotel, Hanoi, Viet Nam.>Book your room in our hotel block!WhenOctober 9-11, 2024 What Does My Ticket Include? •2.5 day attendance to Asia Farm Animal Day•Community meal functions during event hours​•An exclusive welcome swag bag to our first 150 attendees•30+ hours of regionally relevant programming•80+ speakers covering essential, interesting, and current topics on animal advocacy and veganism relevant to the Asia region•Access to all attractions and 20+ exhibiting brands, film fests, and more! Exhibitor Opportunities Join us at Asia Farm Animal Day (AFAD) as an exhibitor and showcase your organization, products, and initiatives to a passionate and engaged audience of animal and vegan advocates from across Asia and beyond. As an exhibitor, you’ll have the opportunity to connect with professionals, activists, and like-minded organizations, fostering collaborations and expanding your reach within the advocacy community. Speaking Opportunities Applications closed as of July 15, 2024. Travel Award Scholarship Opportunities Applications closed as of July 31, 2024.

Service and Companion Animals Policy Though the Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit loves all animals of all sizes and types, we are unable to allow companion animals on site during our sessions, workshops, meals, etc., with the exception of verified service animals. In that case, please get in touch with us beforehand. ​ If you need to travel with your companion animal(s), you may correspond with the hotel venue on your own behalf, and arrange for the needs of you and your companion. Should your companion accompany you during your stay, please respect our policy and refrain from bringing your companion to our scheduled sessions, workshops, meals, etc. In addition, please know that animals can not be left unattended in your room. Thank you for your understanding!

Food and Beverage Policy & Procedures Badge For Meal Functions The Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit is pleased to provide delicious daily meals! We plan far in advance to ensure everyone is well fed, taken care of, and provided with adequate vegan fuel to stay energized during the entirety of the Summit. The name badge that is generated via your ticket registration is your ticket to all meal functions. Those without badges won't be able to attend meal functions. ​ Though we would like to offer meals to everyone, we need to ask that you please help us plan ahead by ensuring you, your friends, colleagues, and your family are all officially registered before the Summit! ​ By taking this step, the organizers of the AVA Summit will be able to account for and accommodate everyone who shows up. Thank you for your understanding! ​ *Please register at the correct allocated tier for the respective event in which you (and your guests) will attend.

Refund Policy & Procedures We honor refund requests received up to 3 weeks prior to the event start time. For help with processing refunds, please email Amie Albright (Communications Lead) directly atAmie@AVASummit.com All other requests are reviewed case-by-case. Please email Amie Albright (Communications Lead) directly atAmie@AVASummit.com Note:If the ticket was purchased via Eventbrite, the processing fee is non-refundable. Learn morehere.

The History of AVA International How did it all start? 2021 The Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit was conceived in 2021. After surveying more than 60 key stakeholders, movement leaders, and major funders, there was an overwhelming consensus: It was time to produce a modern, professional, diverse, and impact-oriented overarching conference for farmed animal, wild animal, and vegan advocates. Because uniting the movement, reducing infighting, and strengthening cross-organizational connections is crucial for creating systemic change. Because a professional flagship conference elevates the reputation of our whole movement. Because it empowers advocates from the Global Majority and neglected regions by increasing their visibility and providing a platform for learning and networking opportunities. Sebastian Joy, Co-Founder and President ofProVeg International, kickstarted what became the AVA Summit in close collaboration withDawn Moncrief, Founder and President ofA Well-Fed World, andMeghan O'Brien Lowery, Director and Partner of theGreenbaum Foundation. All three provided and continue to provide invaluable guidance and support, and they played an absolutely crucial role in getting AVA off the ground. 2023 In 2023, the AVA US event became even bigger, more diverse, and more international with 215 organizations working directly in the movement and over 750 attendees from 47 different countries. In the same year, AVA cooperated withAsia for Animalsto create the first in-person conference for farmed animal advocates in Southeast Asia:Asia Farm Animal Day. 2022 Michael Webermann, at that time US Executive Director ofProVeg International, and Sebastian created, branded, and co-founded the Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) Summit, and it is thanks to their dedication, knowledge, and reputation, that the Summit immediately became the go-to for advocates working or wanting to work in our movement professionally.
Michael built the roots of the project together withAmanda Cramer, President and Principle Planner ofAmanda Cramer Events, who also created the firstLEAD for Farmed Animalsworkshop at that time.

​ Shortly after, Sebastian brought onJulia Reinelt— who had previously created theNew Food Conference, built up the first incubator for alternative protein startups, and worked on strategic planning, impact evaluation, and organizational development — to lead the AVA team and grow the events internationally. ​ The inaugural AVA Summit 2022 in the US met all its primary goals, being the largest movement event since before the pandemic, being substantially more international than any previous similar event, and having an increased focus on the most neglected animals. ​ ​ ​ 2024 While ProVeg provided full fiscal sponsorship and operational support to ensure AVA was top quality from the start, it was decided that AVA should spin off in 2024 to be its own independent organization in light of its immediate success, popularity, and growth potential. All AVA events are now being organized by the US-based nonprofit organization Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) International. The organization is overseen and led byJulia Reinelt(Board Chair & Executive Director),Michael Webermann(Board Secretary), andFlavia D'Erasmo(Board Treasurer) and works with event-specific Advisory Committees consisting of experienced movement representatives who facilitate decision-making, provide current knowledge, diverse perspectives, critical thinking, and analysis.

Statement on Religious, Economic, Cultural, or Political Viewpoints The primary focus and core mission of AVA International is advancing animal rights, animal welfare, and the vegan movement. While we stand in solidarity with all suppressed, oppressed, and abused beings on this planet, we are ourselves not in a position to comment on religious, economic, cultural, or political topics because our expertise lies in organizing impactful events for the animal advocacy and vegan movement. AVA International is a non-ideological, non-partisan organization not associated with any particular religious, economic, cultural, or political system. We do not endorse or criticize any religious, economic, cultural, or political viewpoint, or any other belief system or ideology. AVA International is not responsible for the personal viewpoints of any person associated with our organization or our events, including employees, contractors, volunteers, speakers, sponsors, exhibitors, and attendees. When representing AVA International, our employees, contractors, or anybody associated with AVA International, will not speak about any personal religious, economic, cultural, or political viewpoints. AVA International is a non-ideological, non-partisan organization not associated with any particular religious, economic, cultural, or political system. We are not responsible for the personal viewpoints of any person associated with our events, including speakers. For any further questions, comments, or concerns, please contact Julia Reinelt (Executive Director, AVA International) by email atJulia@AVASummit.com.If you prefer to remain anonymous, please use ouranonymous form.

GDPR Compliant Privacy Policy Please review our GDPR compliant Privacy Policyhere.

Travel Award Scholarship Policy & Procedures The AVA Summit is highly dependent on generous donors who provide us with funding for travel awards, and we need to provide proof of their spending, collect receipts, and respect our fiscal sponsor’s banking procedures. Please read the details below to ensure an adequate understanding of how to use this award, reimbursement details, and award limitations and guidelines. For Domestic and International AwardeesThe travel award covers travel (airplane, train, bus, uber, lyft, public transportation) and venue hotel accommodation. for international and domestic awardees for the dates of the AVA Summit/AFAD event. Please use the banking form sent to you to tell us how to wire the award to you. The award will be split up into two equal transfers.Receipts, such as flight and hotel, that equal or surpass the scholarship amount are required for our records.If your flight and accommodation exceed your Travel Award, we will cover the amount you’ve been granted for your Travel Award. If your flight and accommodation expenses do not meet the entirety of your Travel Award, the AVA Summit will honor the amount of total expenses that were used for travel and accommodations.All reimbursements will be sent directly to the receipt holder of the travel awardee without any exceptions.If you have made the decision to share your hotel room (or any expenses) with one or a group of individuals, it is your responsibility to navigate how you will disburse the reimbursement amongst yourselves.The Travel Award Scholarship does not cover additional meals and snacks throughout the duration of the AVA Summit, as most meals are included in your ticket.

​ For International AwardeesThe travel award covers travel (airplane, train, bus, uber, lyft, public transportation), visa fees, travel insurance, and venue accommodation for international awardees for the dates of the AVA Summit/AFAD event.All travel awardees must have a valid passport and visa to accept the travel award. If a visa invitation letter is required, please emailTravel@AVASummit.com.

The AVA Summit recognizes that many international awardees will fly across the globe to speak or attend the Summit. Therefore, we anticipate that you may arrive a bit earlier due to unforeseen circumstances, such as delayed visas, delayed/canceled flights, or even one night early to synchronize with a new timezone. For this reason, we are allowing a 1-2 day window to the international AVA Summit travel awardees. This will be reviewed and approved on a case-by-case basis. Awardees will be given an attendee registration code that allows them to register at the lowest possible rate during the window in which your application was submitted. Applications submitted after the transitional ticket tier window will receive a discounted Standard ticket registration code. For Domestic AwardeesThe travel award covers travel (airplane, train, bus, uber, lyft, public transportation) and venue accommodation for awardees through the dates of the AVA Summit/AFAD event(s).The AVA Summit does not cover travel or accommodation costs outside of the AVA Summit/AFAD events. Awardees will be given an attendee registration code that allows them to register at the lowest possible rate during the window in which your application was submitted. Applications submitted after the Early Bird ticket tier has closed will receive a discounted Standard registration code. We understand that sometimes things happen outside of the parameters listed above. All such cases will be reviewed by the AVA Summit team, and you will be notified of the verdict as soon as one is made. Please allow up to 7 days for the review process.EmailTravel@AVASummit.comto start the process, or for any questions or comments that you may have.

​​ Reimbursement Process We will email you a reimbursement form and expense report template to complete to receive the second half of your travel award after the conference.  In the meantime, please familiarize yourself with the process and steps below, and feel free to prepare your receipts as described below.

Please read and follow the instructions below to ensure your Travel Awards can be disbursed as soon as possible. Please allow up to 30 business days from the date you submit the expense report for reimbursement. Please follow the exact procedure described below. We will not accept receipts emailed directly to us or in a different format. Thank you! Step 1: Create a copy of theExpense Report. Add each of your expenses in a separate line in the expense report (e.g.  Flight from California to D.C. - $365.48, Hotel Reservation 2 nights - $533.23). Step 2: Export the Expense Report as a PDF. Click on File > Download > PDF Document. Step 3: Gather Supporting Documents *** Assemble PDF copies of all relevant receipts (flights, hotels, transportation). Step 4: Merge the expense report PDF and the receipts into a single file, ensuring they are in the correct order. You can do this online athttps://smallpdf.com/merge-pdf. Step 5: Submit the Merged PDF through the Reimbursement Form Upload the single merged PDF file according to the submission guidelines. Do not upload individual receipts or documents separately. ***Please ensure that you are uploading a verifiable receipt. A screenshot of your hotel booking or of your flight reservation is not a receipt. The receipt should include: Your name The date of payment Vendor Name The proof of payment confirmation including the last 4 digits of the card used for your purchase. ***If your flight and accommodation exceed your Travel Award, we will cover the amount that you’ve received as a Travel Award. If your flight and accommodation expenses do not meet the entirety of your Travel Award, the AVA Summit will honor the amount of total expenses that were used for travel and accommodations. Remember that AVA International will not reimburse you for food or your event ticket. Please be patient, we are working to get your reimbursements to you as soon as we can. Thank you for your understanding!

Harassment Investigation Policy & Procedures Animal & Vegan Advocacy (AVA) International encourages prompt and full reporting of all perceived incidents of discrimination or harassment at any AVA events to the AVA International Executive Director in person, by email atjulia@AVASummit.com, or by submitting this anonymous form. This applies if you believe that you have been harassed or if you witness harassment of another person. If the complaint concerns the Executive Director, please contact Flavia (Board Treasurer) atFavia@AVASummit.comand/or Michael Webermann (Board Secretary) atMichael@AVASummit.com. It is our policy to promptly and thoroughly investigate such reports. Confidentiality will be maintained throughout the investigatory process to the extent consistent with adequate investigation and appropriate corrective action. View our Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy. No policy can fully describe all forms of harassment. All persons at any AVA events are encouraged to report any occasion where they feel harassed, whether or not the specific conduct is captured by this policy. Complaint and Investigation Process AVA International strongly encourages people who believe they or others are being subjected to such conduct to promptly advise the offender that their behavior is unwelcome and request that it be discontinued. We recognize that a person may not always feel comfortable addressing the behavior directly with the offender and may prefer to pursue the matter through official complaint procedures. While timely reporting (ideally within 48 business hours) is preferred, we encourage you to report any complaints or incidents at any time. However, a late report may impair the AVA team’s ability to thoroughly investigate and resolve the complaint. Any reported allegations of harassment, discrimination, or retaliation will be promptly investigated.

The investigation may include individual interviews with the parties involved and, where necessary, with persons who may have observed the alleged conduct or may have other relevant knowledge. At the conclusion of a thorough investigation, both the person who submitted the complaint and any individual accused of harassment or discrimination will be notified of the conclusion of the investigation, including any findings of harassment and any disciplinary or other administrative actions that will be taken.

Submitting false or unjustified complaints against an individual may itself constitute a form of harassment. Anyone who makes false or malicious complaints of harassment, discrimination, or retaliation shall be subject to disciplinary action up to and including expulsion from this and any AVA event. It is AVA International’s intention to consider all claims as soon as possible. Upon receiving a complaint of harassment, the Executive Director or the individual appointed to run the investigation will take the following initial steps, usually within 48 hours whenever possible: 1. Record all the information received from the complainant, including the dates, times, and locations of the incidents, as well as the names of individuals who may have observed the incidents 2. Provide the complainant with an overview of the investigation process and ensure that the complainant understands the timing and scope of the investigation, though with the understanding that no two complaints are the same, and the process and timing will vary depending on the allegations 3. Identify the complainant’s preferred resolution in order to facilitate our understanding of the issue 4. Ensure that records of all discussions remain confidential to the fullest extent possible 5. Take immediate action to limit interactions between the complainant and the alleged harasser while the investigation remains pending, if necessary Usually, within 10 business days after the completion of these initial steps, the Executive Director or the individual appointed to run the investigation will take the following secondary steps: 1. Interview the complainant and, in the case of complaints made by third parties who observed concerning conduct, the individual to whom the conduct was directed 2. Interview witnesses or other knowledgeable persons who may have information relating to the alleged incident(s) 3. Interview the person complained about 4.
Confer as necessary with management to determine the appropriate course of action, including, as appropriate, any disciplinary action to be taken

5. Prepare a final incident report detailing the investigation, any findings, disciplinary actions taken, and recommendations to prevent future incidents 6. Inform the parties involved of any recommendations or disciplinary actions Confidentiality will be maintained throughout the investigatory process to the extent consistent with adequate investigation and appropriate corrective action. Information regarding complaints will be disclosed only as necessary for the investigation and resolution of the complaint. Retaliation against a person for reporting harassment or discrimination or for participating in an investigation of a claim of harassment or discrimination is a serious violation of this policy and, like harassment or discrimination itself, will be subject to disciplinary action. It is crucial to recognize that power imbalances, such as differences in age or positions within organizations or within the movement, may influence the dynamics of reporting and potential retaliation. Acts of retaliation, including those influenced by power differentials, should immediately be reported to any member of the Board and will be promptly investigated and addressed. Misconduct constituting harassment, discrimination, or retaliation shall be subject to disciplinary action up to and including expulsion from this and any AVA event. If the complainant disagrees with the resolution of a complaint, they may consult with the AVA Executive Director and/or the Board to explain why the complainant views the resolution as unsatisfactory and propose an alternative remedy. We'll take these further considerations seriously and aim to create spaces that are safe for all.
